result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Codey R. Opper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called: 2:21pm. INCLUDES 14CF379, 14CF807, 14CF837. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher. Defendant appears in custody by and with Atty James Connell. State makes statement re: plea hearing held yesterday. Atty Connell in agreement. Crt addresses defendant and admonishes defendant. Crt vacates Plea/Sentencing along with Waiver of Prelim in 14CF479.  Waiver of Prelim. filed 14CF479. Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  Information previously filed. Crt proceeds with Plea. Plea/Advisement filed. State moves to DRI 14CF807 & 14CF837-crt grants. PLEA: GUILTY - ct 1 (OWI-4th) 14CF479. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Atty Connell makes statement. Defendant makes statement. COURT ORDERS: SWH - 3 yrs. CONDITIONS: $3,014.00 inclusive cc; 6 months MCJ w/huber if eligible for work, school, treatment and AA; 1 day credit; must report w/in 45 days or discretion of the agent;  No objection to EMP; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 36 months as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed; $50 IID installation fee to be paid; 36 months dl revocation; AODA-Cty Resident; Absolute Sobriety- Alcohol. Crt advises and defendant signs Ineligible Voting Acknowledgment. Adjourned: 2:39pm.

Case called: 10:36am. INCLUDES 14CF479, 14CF807. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Sid Brucbacher. Deft appears in person with Atty James Connell. Parties do not object BR 5 handling BR 4 case. Waiver of Prelim. filed 14CF479. Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  Information filed.  Crt proceeds with Plea. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI 14CF807- crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (OWI-4th). Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Atty Connell makes statement. COURT ORDERS: SWH - 2 yrs & 6 months. CONDITIONS: $3,014.00 inclusive cc; 6 months MCJ w/huber if eligible for work, school or treatment; must report w/in 45 days or discretion of the agent;  Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 36 months as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed; $50 IID installation fee to be paid; 36 months dl revocation; AODA-Cty Resident; Absolute Sobriety. Crt advises and defendant signs Ineligible Voting Acknowledgment. Adjourned: 10:48am.
Pre-trial conference on October 6, 2014 at 10:35 am.
Preliminary Hearing on September 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 1 business day - Day Report Program.  Absolute sobriety.
